results.p: What is binary? Binary describes a numbering scheme in which there are only two possible values for each digit -- 0 or 1 -- and is the basis for all binary code ...

A binary number is made up of only 0s and 1s. There is no 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9 in Binary! Binary numbers have many uses in mathematics and beyond.

results.p: BINARY meaning: 1. using a system of numbers that uses only 0 and 1: 2. relating to or consisting of two things…. Learn more.
A binary code represents text, computer processor instructions, or any other data using a two-symbol system. The two-symbol system used is often "0" and "1" ...
adjective · of or relating to a system of numerical notation to the base 2, in which each place of a number, expressed as 0 or 1, corresponds to a power of 2.
